titlestmt.titleproper: Abraham and Esther Rattner letter to Helen Kroll Kramer

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-28 13:30:30 -0400.

did.unittitle: Abraham and Esther Rattner letter to Helen Kroll Kramer

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A letter from the Rattners to Helen Kroll Kramer thanking her for the "warm fullness of the evening you gave us at your home at Ein Hod."

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 3470 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kramer is an assemblage artist and sculptor. Abraham Rattner (1895-1978) was a painter in New York, N.Y. His 2nd wife, Esther Gentle, was also a painter.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Emily Nathan, a former AAA staff member, 1977. She also donated catalogs of the Kramer Collection at Cornell University and of Kramer's exhibition "Wall Textures" that were transferred to the vertical files of the National Musuem of Art/National Portrait Gallery Library.
